wikipedia_page.main: Sir George Christopher Trout Bartley,  (22 November 1842 – 13 September 1910) was an English civil servant, banker and Conservative politician who sat in the House of Commons from 1885 to 1906.

response: The Conservative Party candidate was Sir George Trout Bartley, a cockney who had been the founder of the National Penny bank and was MP for Islington North from 1885 until his defeat in 1906.
* George Trout Bartley (1842–1910), English civil servant

The Corrupt Practices Act 1883, Reform Act 1884 and the Redistribution of Seats Act 1885 had greatly affected the electoral make-up of the country and Middleton's success in mastering them ensured that he was appointed the Conservatives' principal agent, succeeding George Trout Bartley.The Times (28 February 1905), p. 10. He held this post until July 1903.
*Sir George Trout Bartley MP, member of parliament for Islington North
